clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Strong & Steady - Fall Preventive Group Exercise Program
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Strong & Steady: A Group Exercise Program for Preventing Functional Decline and Falls Among Community Dwelling Older Adults

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to investigate the effect of Strong and Steady (S&S) group exercise on fall risk and physical function among community-dwelling older adults over 12 months. A cluster randomized stepped wedge design will be used.

detailed_description.textblock:
The S&S group exercise program builds on the Otago and FaME exercise programs which have shown to be effective in preventing falls. Strong and steady has been adapted to more functionally fit older people.
The study period will be one year. New participants to Norwegian S&S groups (within participating municipalities) will be randomized to sequentially receive the intervention. Group 1 will start in an S&S group immediately after baseline testing. Group 2 will be followed with assessments over 3 months before they start the S&S training. Assessments will be performed at baseline, and at 3, 6 and 12 months follow-up. All participants will continue to exercise till one year after baseline assessments.This means that by the end of the study all participants will have received the intervention. All testing will be done by trained physiotherapists. Participants will be sent questionnaires before the before they meet at a test station for testing of physical function.

primary_outcome.description: Change in number of stands from a chair managed within a time frame of 30 seconds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Short Physical Performance Battery total score
secondary_outcome.description: Includes 5x Sit-to-stand, 4 meters walk test and 3 different 10 sec stance positions. Change in total score (0-12 points).
Number of falls will be collected by daily calendars collected every month

The Short Falls Efficacy Scale-International (Short FES-I) questionnaire will be used to assess fear of falling. The total score range from 7 (no concern about falling) to 28 (severe concern about falling). Change in total score will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One week monitoring at baseline, 3, 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Axivity activity sensors fixed to the lower back ang thigh will be used to measure everyday physical activity. Change in time spent doing physical activity will be assessed.
Change in number of stands from a chair managed within a time frame of 30 seconds.

arm_group.description: Will start a Strong & Steady group exercise programme immediately after baseline testing.
Will be advised to follow the national recommendations for physical activity for 3 months after baseline testing, then start a Strong & Steady group exercise programme

intervention.description: The community-based group exercise program S&S, with strengthening and balance exercise as the main components. The participants will attend a once-weekly, one hour supervised session. The exercises that will be used can be found in the S&S handbook which includes different difficulty levels. All instructors are volunteers and have completed the S&S education. Each exercise session will consist of a warm-up (5-8 min.), endurance exercises (10-15 min.), strength exercises (15 min.), balance exercises (20 min.) and a cool down/stretching (5 min.). In addition to attending the group exercises, the participants will be taught and encouraged to do home exercises twice a week from hand out leaflets that can be found at www.sterkogstodig.no.

Will be given the Norwegian recommendations for physical activity: https://www.helsedirektoratet.no/faglige-rad/fysisk-aktivitet-for-barn-unge-voksne-eldre-og-gravide/fysisk-aktivitet-for-voksne-og-eldre

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to get to the training facilities on their own
- Able to walk without a walking aid indoors
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with dementia
